執事.definition: paraphernalia of a guard of honor

執勤.definition: to be on duty (of a security guard etc)

執委.definition: executive committee member (abbr. for 執行委員|执行委员[zhi2xing2 wei3yuan2])

執委會.definition: executive committee (abbr. for 執行委員會|执行委员会[zhi2xing2 wei3yuan2hui4])

執念.definition: obsession (CL:股[gu3]); (when followed by 於|于[yu2]) to be obsessive (about)

執意.definition: to be determined to; to insist on

執政官.definition: consul (of the Roman Republic); magistrate (chief administrator)

執政黨.definition: ruling party; the party in power

執教.definition: to teach; to be a teacher; to train; to coach

執業.definition: to work in a profession (e.g. doctor, lawyer); practitioner; professional

執法.definition: to enforce a law; law enforcement

執法如山.definition: to maintain the law as firm as a mountain (idiom); to enforce the law strictly

執牛耳.definition: to be the acknowledged leader (from the custom of a prince holding a plate on which lay the severed ears of a sacrificial bull at an alliance ceremony)

執筆.definition: to write; to do the actual writing

執著.definition: to be strongly attached to; to be dedicated; to cling to; (Buddhism) attachment

執行.definition: to implement; to carry out; to execute; to run

執迷.definition: to be obsessive; to persist obstinately

執迷不悟.definition: to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)

執金吾.definition: (Han dynasty) official in command of an army responsible for maintaining law and order in the capital

執飛.definition: (of an airline) to run a flight
